descendants.content:
@FantasticalEconomics His record with 3M and PFOS cleanup is pretty impressive. Centrist, granted. It would cost more than 3M is worth to clean up the PFOS they've manufactured. They're stopping, though, and have it in their, um, business plan? to continue cleanup.

He's all about heading in the right direction sustainably, including the capital.

account.note: (she/her) #M4A #H4A #CleanEnergy #ESG #EV #GlassBlowing #Feminism #Minnesota #UChicago (proud parent) #Pacisfism #VoteBlue #ActuallyAutistic #LGBTQIA2S+ BA in music from a conservative college and the damage to prove it. (Yes, that means I code.) Please help me advocate for disaffected voters.

fields.name: header pic
fields.value: 1984 landslide election map, showing all states red except for Minnesota and D.C.

descendants.content:
@janisf

Agreed!

Heading in the right direction is all we can reasonably hope for. The "right thing" in terms of climate is currently viewed as beyond extreme and would have no hope if getting elected.

That's not to say we shouldn't keep pushing for more. We should. But we also need to be happy with the gains we can realistically make. And this seems like great progress to me!

account.note:
I'm an environmental economist who researches econ pedagogy to make learning economics marginally less dismal.

My pipe-dream is to write a fantasy novel/economics textbook, which is getting closer to reality every day.

#economics #TeachEcon #sustainability #DoughnutEconomics #degrowth

Profile pic is me smiling in front of a whiteboard with economics gibberish -- cause econ makes me happy.

Background is my dog, Freya, who is derpily sticking her tongue out while passed out.

fields.name: About me
fields.value: Making econ marginally less dismal one post at a time. I teach economics at the UC Denver and am an all around nerd. My goal is to combine my passion for all things fantasy/sci-fi and love of economics to lower the cost of learning econ.

fields.name: Fantastical Economics
fields.value: You can find my first-ever short story that covers the circular economy and sustainability in a sci-fi setting here: https://edgeryders.eu/t/circular-reasoning/19717

Thanks for sharing it!

descendants.content:
@FantasticalEconomics I can't actually source that. I just know a couple 3M employees, read about them, and put it together. They still make a whole lot of plastic medical product, but their R&D is focused on that as a problem, and they share progress openly, specifically with South Pacific manufacturers.

Could be better, could be worse. Right direction. I think Walz is fabulous.

descendants.content:
@FantasticalEconomics@geekdom.social

“We can't move too fast when it comes to addressing #ClimateChange.”
That's the thing, you can feel that something's wrong with the climate – especially if you're old enough to remember 40 or so years ago's weather. Further, you can feel that its either accelerating or has reached some critical milestones that make it feel like it's accelerating. If you haven't burried your head in the sand, you know that something probably needs to be done post haste. That's not a liberal vs. conservative thing (particularly if you're comparing to the meaning of "conservative" I grew up with), that's a "I'm concerned about my future and my children's future" thing.

account.note: Ex of Twitter (and many others before that) by way of mastodon.social (same user ID across a lot of platforms). Moved here because I like the ability to format posts and, sometimes, I need more than 500 characters ...plus there had been rumblings about mastodon.social getting widely defederated.

descendants.content:
@ferricoxide

Truth. I'm hoping the fever will break after this election and the Right will realign itself dramatically. A big one being their increasingly untenable denial of climate change.

I don't know if it's likely, but I hope it fervently.

account.note: Just starting to see how little I really know.

descendants.content:
@FantasticalEconomics Note however that Walz isn't all sunshine and roses on climate.

https://www.eenews.net/articles/tim-walzs-energy-record-political-asset-or-liability/

"...he did not always stand in the way of fossil fuels, including when his administration helped approve a contested oil pipeline."

"Collin Rees, political director of Oil Change U.S., knocked Walz over the Line 3 project...

His lack of action to stop the Line 3 pipeline shows a troubling deference to fossil fuel interests,” Rees said..."

#Harris2024 #Timwalz
